Class com.chimu.kernel.PackageLib 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----com.chimu.kernel.Library
           |
           +----com.chimu.kernel.PackageLib
public abstract class PackageLib
extends Library
A PackageLib is a root class (more a root concept) of Package "objects" implemented solely as static-side functionality (i.e. as a Library).

The PackageLib are where the functionality of a Package is specified/documented.

All PackageLibs should have a suffix of "Pack". This documents that they are a PackageLibrary and prevents collisions with the normal types and classes within the package.

PackageLibs are closely related with Packages and PackageClasses. If a given Java Package has a PackageLib and a PackageClass then they should support almost identical behavior. In many cases the PackageClass should have functionality implemented via a PackageLib.

PackageLib currently provides no inheritable functionality, so this class is primarily to define and document the concept of a PackageLib.

See Also:
Package, Library
